clusters.title: TikTok Usage
clusters.description: As of 2024, 33% of U.S. adults use TikTok, with 17% regularly getting news from the platform, a significant increase from 3% in 2020. Among U.S. adult TikTok users, 52% get news there, and 39% of adults under 30 do the same. The 'For You' page is found extremely interesting by 40% of users, while 68% of TikTok news consumers rely on influencers or celebrities. A majority, 95%, use TikTok for entertainment, with only 15% citing news as a major usage reason.

clusters.title: TikTok Ban
clusters.description: The support for banning TikTok among U.S. adults has decreased from 50% in March to 38%. Currently, 50% of Americans believe it is unlikely that TikTok will be banned, while 31% think a ban is somewhat likely. Only 6% believe a ban is very likely, and 19% are unsure about the possibility of a ban.

merged_facts.merged_content: Support for banning TikTok among U.S. adults decreased from 50% in March 2023 to 38% in October 2023, and further to 32% in Late 2023.

titles.chart_title: Decline in Support for TikTok Ban Among U.S. Adults

facts.fact_group_content: Support for banning TikTok among U.S. adults declined from 50% in March to 38% now.

article.title: Support for US TikTok ban falls among adults, is low for teens

fact_group_facts.fact_content: Support for the U.S. government banning TikTok decreased from 50% in March 2023 to 38% in fall 2023 and to 32% now.

article.title: Support for US TikTok ban declines, and half of adults are skeptical

merged_facts.narrative: In 2023, the sentiment among U.S. adults towards banning TikTok showed a significant shift. In March, 50% supported a ban, but by October, this number had fallen to 38%. By late 2023, support dwindled further to just 32%, indicating a growing acceptance of the app.

all_merged_facts_in_order.merged_content: Support for banning TikTok among U.S. adults decreased from 50% in March 2023 to 38% in October 2023, and further to 32% in Late 2023.

titles.chart_title: Decline in Support for TikTok Ban Among U.S. Adults

facts.fact_group_content: Support for banning TikTok among U.S. adults declined from 50% in March to 38% now.

fact_group_articles.title: Support for US TikTok ban declines, and half of adults are skeptical

fact_group_facts.fact_content: Support for banning TikTok among U.S. adults declined from 50% in March to 38% now.

article.title: Support for US TikTok ban falls among adults, is low for teens

fact_group_facts.fact_content: Support for the U.S. government banning TikTok decreased from 50% in March 2023 to 38% in fall 2023 and to 32% now.

article.title: Support for US TikTok ban declines, and half of adults are skeptical

all_merged_facts_in_order.narrative: In 2023, the sentiment among U.S. adults towards banning TikTok showed a significant shift. In March, 50% supported a ban, but by October, this number had fallen to 38%. By late 2023, support dwindled further to just 32%, indicating a growing acceptance of the app.
